data.question: What is the chemical formula of CPM-4?
What method was used for the synthesis of CPM-4?
data.answer: A mixture of In(NO3)3·xH2O, CoCl2·4H2O, and 1,3,5-benzenetricarboxylic acid (H3BTC) was stirred in N,N-dimethylformamide (DMF) for 1 hr, then transferred into a vial and kept at 100 oC for 5 days.

What is the role of isonicotinic acid in the synthesis of CPM-31?
data.answer: Isonicotinic acid serves as an auxiliary ligand, with its pyridal ends anchored to the open metal sites of the In3O trimeric nodes, and its carboxyl ends stretching toward the centers of channels to capture metal ions.

Does the extended hook method allow for the capture of single metal ions or clusters in MOFs?
What is the primary difference between the BTC method and the extended hook method in MOF synthesis?
data.answer: The BTC method relies on the cooperative action of hooks from multiple ligands for metal capture, while the extended hook method uses auxiliary ligands anchored at open metal sites for metal capture, independent of the framework organic ligand.
